senses.sense_definition: The part of a barn where hay is stored, often a loft or a specific bay.

examples.text: The children loved to climb the ladder and play in the <w>haymow</w> on rainy afternoons.
Farmers spent the entire day pitching fresh bales up into the <w>haymow</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A large pile or mass of hay stored inside a barn.

examples.text: The stray cat found a warm spot to sleep on top of the soft <w>haymow</w>.
Spontaneous combustion can occur deep within a damp <w>haymow</w> if it is not properly ventilated.
